subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Help getting software
msgSnippet: I have to download and burn a DVD to get TeX Live working, I believe. That might not be a bad idea. I thought you might use the private area. But how do you
messageBody:
I have to download and burn a DVD to get TeX Live working, I believe.
That might not be a bad idea.

I thought you might use the private area. But how do you get the font to
correspond to the Unicode you have set aside? I'm sorry since I know
posters have already discussed this issue, but I just joined the group.
Also, now that I think of it, what exactly do your perl scripts do?

Using HTML is a good idea. I hadn't thought of that. You can even set up
CSS stylesheets for printing, so you could get reasonable good quality.
On Mac and linux, you can write the HTML, bring it up in a browser, then
save it as PDF. Voila. Not as nice as TeX, but I don't plan on writing
any books, so for now...

Paul

I have to download and burn a DVD to get TeX Live working, I believe. 
That might not be a bad idea.

I thought you might use the private area. But how do you get the font to 
correspond to the Unicode you have set aside? I'm sorry since I know 
posters have already discussed this issue, but I just joined the group. 
Also, now that I think of it, what exactly do your perl scripts do?

Using HTML is a good idea. I hadn't thought of that. You can even set up 
CSS stylesheets for printing, so you could get reasonable good quality. 
On Mac and linux, you can write the HTML, bring it up in a browser, then 
save it as PDF. Voila. Not as nice as TeX, but I don't plan on writing 
any books, so for now...

Paul
